From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From abús +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [ə.βuˈza]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [ə.buˈza]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [a.buˈzaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)
  • Hyphenation: a‧bu‧sar

Verb

[edit]

abusar (first-person singular present abuso, first-person singular preterite abusí, past participle abusat)

  1. (intransitive, abusar de) to abuse (use improperly)
  2. to rape
    Synonym: violar

Conjugation

[edit]

plural abusats abusades

negative (no) — no abusis no abusi no abusem no abuseu no abusin

Related terms

[edit]
  • abusador
  • abusiu

Further reading

[edit]
  • “abusar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007

Hiligaynon

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Spanish abusar.

Noun

[edit]

abusár

  1. misuse, abuse

Verb

[edit]

abusár

  1. to misuse or abuse, to take advantage of

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From abuso +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /a.buˈza(ʁ)/ [a.buˈza(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /a.buˈza(ʁ)/ [a.buˈza(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /a.buˈza(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /a.buˈza(ʁ)/ [a.buˈza(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /a.buˈza(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ɐ.buˈzaɾ/ [ɐ.βuˈzaɾ]
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ɐ.buˈzaɾ/ [ɐ.βuˈzaɾ]
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /ɐ.buˈza.ɾi/ [ɐ.βuˈza.ɾi]

  • Hyphenation: a‧bu‧sar

Verb

[edit]

abusar (first-person singular present abuso, first-person singular preterite abusei, past participle abusado)

  1. to abuse
  2. to insult

Conjugation

[edit]

Derived terms

[edit]
  • abusado
  • abusador

Descendants

[edit]
  • Kabuverdianu: abuza

Further reading

[edit]
  • “abusar”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From abuso +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /abuˈsaɾ/ [a.β̞uˈsaɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: a‧bu‧sar

Verb

[edit]

abusar (first-person singular present abuso, first-person singular preterite abusé, past participle abusado)

  1. to abuse, to betray
  2. to misuse
  3. (pronominal, Guatemala) to get clever, to get smart, to wise up
    Synonyms: espabilarse, avivarse

Conjugation

[edit]

gerund abusando
past participle masculine feminine
singular abusado abusada
plural abusados abusadas

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
